result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth George Scharp Jr.

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Nov 7;  ka

HAS $2000 POSTED ALREADY
COVERS CASES 21CM146, 22CM14, 22CF131, and 22CF58.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ J.M.F. or residence not to be within one city block or place that J.M.F. is at.

HAS $2000 POSTED ALREADY
COVERS CASES 21CM146, 22CM14, 22CF131, and 22CF58.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ J.M.F. or residence not to be within one city block or place that J.M.F. is at.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:29 AM Defendant Kenneth George Scharp Jr. appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Kenneth George Scharp Jr.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM146, 22CF58, 22CF131, and 22CM14.  Def scheduled for Stc on 10/17.  Warrants in each case quashed.  FF of bond is vacated.  Government road address correct.  State comments on bail/bond.  Atty comments on bail/bond.  Def does qualify for PD services.  Atty represents def in some cases, looking for Atty in case 22CF131.  Court orders $4000 cash already has $2000 posted.  NON-monetary conditions remain in place.  Bond covers all cases.  AIA in 22CF131 Stc in other cases.  If def is at liberty he needs to appear in person.

10:07 AM Defendant Kenneth George Scharp Jr. not in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Kenneth George Scharp Jr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM146, 22CF58, 22CF131, and 22CM14.  Atty, no information for court.  State asking for warrant BOW, ff of bond.  Court warrant authorized in cases, ff of bond, send notice if no response in 30 days judgment will enter.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:05 PM Defendant Kenneth George Scharp Jr. in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Kenneth George Scharp Jr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM146, 22CF58, 22CF131, and 22CM14.  Arraignment in 22CF58 Atty has recv'd copy of complaint, waives reading, plead NG, noted.  22CF131 is an initial appearance and it is a conflict case with Atty Brewer.  Atty would like to find an atty to take all cases.  22CF131 will be initial appearance all other cases STC to track along.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Kenneth George Scharp Jr. in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Kenneth George Scharp Jr.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM146, 22CF58, 22CF131. and 22CM14.  22CF58 here for prelim hearing, 22CF131 hear for 131 Atty not appointed in this case.  
22CF58 no prelim, waiving right to prelim hearing.  Def discussed waiving right to prelim hearing with Atty.  Def understands rights, and rights giving up, Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver right to prelim hearing.  Reviewed PC finds PC that a felony was committed in ashland county, bound over for arraignment.  State filed information now, emailed copy to Atty contains same counts.  Atty asking for arraignment at a later date.  Remaining cases to track.  
22CF131, def contacted the PD office, does qualify, Atty has a conflict with case.  Waiting for an attorney to be appointed. in this case.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:33 PM Defendant Kenneth George Scharp Jr. in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Kenneth George Scharp Jr.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF58, 21CM146, 22CM14, and 22CF131.  22CF131 no atty.  Initial appearance not completed in any case.  State agrees.  Atty asking for breakout to talk with def.  Back on the record 1:44.  Atty not appointed in 22CF131, needs to contact PD office and appoint an atty.  The other three cases has recv'd copy of compliants, waives reading, waives time limit for prelim hearing.  21CM146 and 22CM14 NG noted.  In 22CF58, waiving time limits for prelim hearing, court accepts waiver.  22cf131 will be an initial appearance, same day  22cf58 prelim hearing at 1000 9/19, other cases will track along as STC. 22CF131 conditions of release, bail hearing 8/12 was discussed, apply cash bail to 22CF131, State agrees to add case.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
